intro: Eremolaena darainensis, commonly known as the Daraina eremolaena, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in arid regions of the island. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
